page.title: 06CHURCHILL PARISH CHURCH
page.content: All Saints' Church was built in 1826 by Squire Langston, replacing the demolished church. Outstanding features are the tower, a 2/3 replica of Magdalen College, Oxford, and the nave's hammerbeam roof, based on Christ Church Hall, Oxford. In 1971 the tower was pronounced unsound, corrosion of metal supports weakening the stone. An appeal was launched and Â£10,000 raised for restoration. The Electoral Roll has 55 names, and congregations are small for this large building. The cost of upkeep is high, for repairs and renewals are a constant problem. The parish is part of a united benefice with Sarsden, Kingham and Daylesford. A service takes place in Churchill every Sunday, and occasionally the churches of the benefice hold a combined service.
